Claude Lejeune<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/july-2017.ashx |title=List of Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/07/2017 and 31/07/2017 |publisher=The Football Association |format=PDF |page=20 |accessdate=2 February 2019}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|5|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Paris]], Levallois 92|Racing Levallois]] | youthclubs4 = Béziers Cheminots | youthclubs5 = [[FC Sète|Sète]] | youthclubs6 = [[RCO Agde|Agde]] | clubs1 = [[RCO Agde|Agde]] | clubs2 = [[FC Istres|Istres]] | years1 = 2008–2009 | years2 = 2009–2011 | caps1 = 3 | caps2 = 42 | goals1 = 2 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2011–2014 | clubs3 = [[Villarreal CF B|Villarreal B]] | caps3 = 36 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2011–2014 | clubs4 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2013–2014 | clubs5 = → [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]] (loan) | caps5 = 21 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2014–2015 | clubs6 = [[Girona FC|Girona]] | caps6 = 38 | goals6 = 4 | years7 = 2015–2016 | clubs7 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps7 = 0 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2015–2016 | clubs8 = → [[Girona FC|Girona]] (loan) | caps8= 38 | goals8 = 3 | years9 = 2016–2017 | clubs9 = [[SD Eibar|Eibar]] | caps9= 34 | goals9 = 1 | years10 = 2017– | clubs10 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps10= 32 | goals10 = 0 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] | nationalyears1 = 2010–2011 | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | club-update = 09:07, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 4 July 2017 }} '''Florian Grégoire Claude Lejeune''' ({{IPA-fr|flɔʁjɑ̃ ləʒən}}; born 20 May 1991) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref name="lejeune_transfer">{{cite web | url = https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110707_103719_lejeune-istres-a-villarreal.html | publisher = [[L'Equipe]] | title = Lejeune (Istres) à Villarreal | date = 7 July 2011 | accessdate = 9 July 2011 | language = French | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110809154738/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110707_103719_lejeune-istres-a-villarreal.html | archive-date = 9 August 2011 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://www.sdeibar.com/noticia/florian-lejeune-jugador-de-sd-eibar-para-las-cuatro-proximas-temporadas Florian Lejeune, jugador de SD Eibar para las cuatro proximal temporadas], sdeibar.com, 29 June 2016</ref> He is equally adept at playing as either a [[Defender (football)|defender]] or a [[midfielder]], but plays mostly as a centre back.
Lejeune joined Villarreal ahead of the [[2011–12 Segunda División|2011–12 season]] after spending one season with [[RCO Agde|Agde]] in the [[Championnat de France amateur]] and two seasons with [[FC Istres|Istres]] in [[Ligue 2]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.stat2foot.com/agde0809.htm | publisher = Stat2Foot | title = Football Agde Effectif 2008/2009 | language = French | date = | accessdate = 4 January 2011 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120319023519/http://www.stat2foot.com/agde0809.htm | archive-date = 19 March 2012 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.fcistres.com/actu-1154-florian-lejeune-vraiment-de-la-qualite.html | publisher = [[FC Istres]] | title = Florian Lejeune: Vraiment de la qualité |language = French |date = 23 September 2010 | accessdate = 28 September 2010}}</ref>
==Career== ===Early career=== Lejeune was born in [[Paris]] and began his football career in July 1998 at the Centre de Formation de Paris, a youth sporting club designed to cater only to football players under the age of 19.<ref name ="lejeune_career">{{cite web | url = http://www.fff.fr/selections/20ans/actualite/535214.shtml | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | title = Nouveau cap pour Florian Lejeune |language = French |date = 8 October 2010 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.cffp.fr/accueilcffp_histoireducffp.htm | title = Histoire du CFFP | date = | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | publisher = Centre de Formation de Paris | language = French | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110720210916/http://www.cffp.fr/accueilcffp_histoireducffp.htm | archivedate = 20 July 2011 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> After four months at the academy, he departed for Racing Club des Ternes, a local sporting club based in the [[8th arrondissement of Paris]].<ref name ="lejeune_career"/> Lejeune spent two years at the club and, in 2000, was signed by [[Racing Levallois 92|Racing Club de France]].<ref name="lejeune_career"/> He spent the majority of his youth career at the club and, after a five-year stay, moved down south to join Béziers Méditerranée Cheminots, a [[sports club]] more known for its [[Athletics (sport)|athletics]] department. With Béziers, Lejeune played in the ''Championnat de France 14 ans Fédéraux'' league.
After one year at Béziers, Lejeune joined the youth academy of [[FC Sète|Sète]]. After two years with the club, he signed an amateur contract with [[RCO Agde|Adge]], which was playing in the [[Championnat de France amateur]], the fourth level of [[Football in France|French football]].<ref name ="lejeune_sport">{{cite web | url = http://www.sport24.com/football/ligue-2/actualites/lejeune-prenom-florian-434141/ | publisher = Sport24 | title = Lejeune, prénom Florian |language = French |date = 3 December 2010 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref> Lejeune spent the majority of the [[2008–09 Championnat de France amateur|2008–09 season]] playing on the club's reserve team. Towards the end of the campaign, he was called up to the senior team and made his amateur debut on 11 April 2009 appearing as a substitute in a 3–1 defeat to [[Gazélec Ajaccio]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.foot-national.com/fiche-match-football-11507.html | title = Agde v. Gazélec Ajaccio Match Report | date = 11 April 2009 | work = Foot-National | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | language = French}}</ref> On 23 May, he made his first start in a 3–2 victory over [[Gap FC|Gap]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.foot-national.com/fiche-match-football-11959.html | title = Agde v. Gap Ajaccio Match Report | date = 23 May 2009 | work = Foot-National | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | language = French}}</ref> The following week, Lejeune scored both goals for Agde in a 2–2 draw with [[Étoile Fréjus Saint-Raphaël|Fréjus Saint-Raphaël]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.foot-national.com/fiche-match-football-11327.html | title = Fréjus Saint-Raphaël v. Agde Match Report | date = 23 May 2009 | work = Foot-National | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | language = French}}</ref>
===Istres=== In the summer of 2009, Lejeune joined [[Ligue 2]] club [[FC Istres|Istres]] on trial. After impressing in two [[Exhibition match|friendly matches]], he was signed to a three-year professional contract and inserted onto the club's reserve team.<ref name ="lejeune_sport"/> Lejeune arrived at the club playing primarily in the [[Midfielder|defensive midfielder]] role, but ultimately switched to the centre back position.<ref name ="lejeune_career"/> His positive play during the fall season with the reserves led to the player being called up to the senior team in January 2010. Lejeune made his professional debut on 19 January in a league match against [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]] in a 0–0 draw with the player playing the entire match.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53317 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Guingamp v. Tours Match Report |language = French |date = 19 January 2010 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref> Lejuene finished the campaign with 14 more appearances in the league playing the entire match in all of them.
Lejeune began the [[2010–11 Ligue 1|2010–11 season]] as a starter and made his season debut in a 4–0 defeat to [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]] in the [[Coupe de la Ligue]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/54393 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Ajaccio v. Tours Match Report |language = French |date = 30 July 2010 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref> In September, he was a surprise inclusion in the [[France national under-20 football team|France under-20 team]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.laprovence.com/actu/region-en-direct/football-florian-lejeune-en-equipe-de-france-u20 | publisher = La Provence | title = Florian Lejeune en équipe de France U20 |language = French |date = 27 September 2010 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref> His subsequent uprising into the spotlight and positive play with Istres led to the player being declared one of the best players in Ligue 2, despite only playing in a handful of matches. On 4 January 2011, French newspaper [[L'Equipe]] announced that [[Spain|Spanish]] club [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] was monitoring Lejeune's progress.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110104_084511_le-real-a-un-oeil-sur-lejeune.html | publisher = [[L'Equipe]] | title = Le Real a un oeil sur Lejeune | date = 4 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | language = French | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110107090259/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110104_084511_le-real-a-un-oeil-sur-lejeune.html# | archive-date = 7 January 2011 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He was, subsequently, linked to a host of other clubs, notably [[England|English]] clubs [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Italy|Italian]] clubs [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] and [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] with all the clubs reportedly likening him to former [[France national football team|French international]] [[Laurent Blanc]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/man-utd-man-city-watching-fc-istres-defender-florian-lejeune-1367861 | publisher = Tribal Football | title = Man Utd, Man City watching FC Istres defender Florian Lejeune |date = 5 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.calciomercato.it/news/104324/Calciomercato-Napoli-e-Udinese-interessa-il-nuovo-Blanc.html | publisher = Calcio Mercato | title = Calciomercato Napoli e Udinese, interessa il "nuovo Blanc" |date = 5 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 January 2011 | language = Italian}}</ref><ref name ="lejeune_arsenal">{{cite web | url = http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/48827/Arsenal_join_Real_in_race_for_defensive_starlet_Lejeune.aspx | publisher = Sport.co.uk | title = Arsenal join Real in race for defensive starlet Lejeune |date = 7 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 January 2011}}</ref> However, despite the speculation, club president Francis Collado declared that he had not had official contact with any club linked to the player.<ref name ="lejeune_arsenal"/>
===Villarreal=== [[File:Florian Lejeune 01.JPG|thumb|Lejeune with [[Villarreal CF B|Villarreal B]] in 2012.]] On 7 July 2011, French newspaper ''[[L'Equipe]]'' confirmed that Lejeune had reached an agreement with [[Spain|Spanish]] club [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] to sign a four-year contract.<ref name="lejeune_transfer"/> The transfer fee was priced at [[Euro|€]]1 million and Lejeune took his medical and signed his contract following the conclusion of his participation in the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].<ref name="lejeune_transfer"/><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.boursorama.com/lifestyle/details_actualites.phtml?currentRubrique=Sport&num=3d56af372a2c5c9b381759edd5706e77 | publisher = Boursorama | title = Lejeune (Istres) à Villarreal |language = French |date = 7 July 2011 | accessdate = 9 July 2011 }}</ref> He was placed onto the club's [[Villarreal CF B|second team]]. After appearing in seven matches with the B team, Lejeune made his senior team debut on 6 November 2011 appearing as a substitute in a 0–0 draw with [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323930?cc=5901 | publisher = [[ESPN]] | title = Forlin red costs Espanyol |date = 6 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 November 2011}}</ref> In January 2013, he was loaned to [[Ligue 1]] side [[Stade Brestois 29]]. It was announced in July 2013 that Lejeune would be loaned out to the newly relegated club for another year.<ref>{{cite web | url =https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Lejeune-reste-a-brest/383837 | publisher = L'Équipe.fr | title = Lejeune reste à Brest |language = French |date = 5 July 2013 | accessdate =20 August 2013}}</ref>
===Girona=== After his loan with Brest ended, Lejeune signed a two-year deal with [[Girona FC]] also in the second level.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20140715/futbol/liga-segunda-division/el-girona-ficha-a-lejeune_54411143096.html|title=El Girona ficha a Lejeune|trans-title=Girona signs Lejeune|publisher=[[El Mundo Deportivo (newspaper)|El Mundo Deportivo]]|language=es|date=15 July 2014|accessdate=10 April 2015}}</ref> He was an undisputed first-choice for the [[Catalonia|Catalans]], scoring his first goal on 8 February 2015, in a 1–0 win at [[CD Tenerife]].
Lejeune finished [[2014–15 Segunda División|the campaign]] with 40 appearances and five goals, as his side narrowly missed out promotion in [[2015 Segunda División play-offs|the play-offs]].
===Manchester City=== On 28 August 2015 Lejeune was transferred to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], being immediately loaned back to Girona for one year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gironafc.cat/-/florian-lejeune|title=El Girona FC traspasa a Lejeune al Manchester City y este lo cede al Club de Montilivi|trans-title=Girona FC transfers Lejeune to Manchester City and the latter loans him to the club of Montilivi|publisher=Girona's official website|language=es|date=28 August 2015|accessdate=28 August 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150901024051/http://www.gironafc.cat/-/florian-lejeune|archive-date=1 September 2015|dead-url=yes}}</ref>
===Eibar=== On 29 June 2016, Lejeune signed a four-year deal with [[SD Eibar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sdeibar.com/noticia/florian-lejeune-jugador-de-sd-eibar-para-las-cuatro-proximas-temporadas|title=Florian Lejeune, jugador de SD Eibar para las cuatro próximas temporadas|trans-title=Florian Lejeune, SD Eibar player for the following four seasons|publisher=SD Eibar|language=es|date=29 June 2016|accessdate=30 June 2016}}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== On 4 July 2017, Lejeune joined Newcastle United on a five-year contract.
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 13 May 2018}} <ref name="FLSW">{{soccerway|florian-lejeune/112529|accessdate=13 October 2017}}</ref>
